comments: Replay review of the foul called on Butler (MIA) pursuant to a coach's challenge was deemed successful. Whiteside (UTA) is moving laterally into Butler's path and does not establish himself in a legal guarding position when he makes contact with Butler's body, which affects his driving shot attempt.
Adebayo (MIA) places a resting forearm to Conley's (UTA) front and marginal contact occurs as it does not affect Conley's ability to maintain his intended path on his drive to the basket.
Whiteside (UTA) receives the ball within 3 seconds of being in the lane and immediately dunks it.
O'Neale (UTA) and Butler (MIA) mutually engage and disengage on the perimeter and marginal contact occurs, which does not affect Butler's ability to get into his legal screening position.
Conley (UTA) maintains a legal guarding position on Butler (MIA) during the drive.
During the pick, Adebayo (MIA) and Whiteside (UTA) engage and disengage and the contact is marginal.
Herro (MIA) maintains a legal guarding position during the driving shot attempt by Mitchell (UTA).
During the drive, Conley (UTA) makes clean ball contact to poke it loose from Butler (MIA).
Conley (UTA) gains possession of the ball and is able to throw it back inbounds before landing out of bounds. The ball touches Butler's (MIA) hands last before going out of bounds.
Adebayo (MIA) legally contests Mitchell's (UTA) jump shot attempt.

Martin (MIA) maintains a legal guarding position during the play at the basket by Whiteside (UTA) and cleanly blocks the shot. Any follow through contact to Whiteside's hand or arm after the block is deemed incidental.

At the end of the drive, Lowry (MIA) establishes himself outside of the RA when O'Neale (UTA) slips the majority of the contact by jumping to the side and marginal contact occurs as he brushes Lowry's body while passing the ball.
Whiteside (UTA) could be deemed to be in the lane for less than three seconds when the shot is imminent.
Mitchell (UTA) makes contact with Herro's (MIA) body upon receiving the inbounds pass, which affects his SQBR.
Butler (MIA) has his hand resting on Mitchell's (UTA) side momentarily and marginal contact occurs as he immediately removes it, which does not affect his FOM.
Tucker (MIA) and Bogdanovic (UTA) engage and disengage and marginal contact occurs as they approach the screen.
During the drive, Lowry (MIA) places a resting hand on Mitchell's (UTA) arm and marginal contact occurs before he makes clean ball contact to temporarily dislodge it from Mitchell.
Gobert (UTA) is late to establish himself in a screening position in Tucker's (MIA) path and delivers contact on the screen.
Mitchell (UTA) regains possession after the dislodge by Lowry (MIA) and dribbles the ball on the baseline out of bounds before his gather.

Adebayo (MIA) reaches for the ball and marginal contact occurs as he brushes Gobert's (UTA) arm, which does not affect his ability to maintain full control of the ball before starting his upward shooting motion.
Gobert (UTA) receives the ball and slides his pivot foot before his shot attempt.
Gobert (UTA) is in the lane for less than 3 seconds when he receives the pass and immediately dunks.
Martin (MIA) makes clean ball contact during his block attempt on Gobert's (UTA) shot near the rim.
Conley (UTA) commits a take foul on Butler (MIA).

During the screen, Bogdanovic (UTA) slightly extends his arm outside of his frame and marginal contact occurs with Adebayo (MIA), which does not affect his ability to maintain his legal guarding position.
Butler (MIA) legally contests Mitchell's (UTA) jump shot attempt.
During the rebound, Lowry (MIA) and Ingles (UTA) come together and incidental contact occurs as they pursue the loose ball.
Conley (UTA) extends his arm out and brushes Butler's (MIA) arm when marginal contact occurs that does not affect his SQBR.
